citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
There was a shitzu female "Ellie" (Brown/white) that had multiple wounds on both back legs in the flank area. The dog
was in a fight with another female approximately 2 days prior in the run yard. The haircoat was hard to the touch (crusty
texture) due to tissue fluids from the wounds beneath it seaping. There were several areas beneath the haircoat that
showed a break in the skin where tooth marks were present. While they didnt appear deep, there was a green puss that
came out of the wounds in multiple areas and the smell was very pungent and smelled of infection. The legs did appear
painful upon examination as the dog pulled away several times. The legs appeared swollen/red and warm to the touch.
While the licensee did seperate the dog and washed down the area after the fight, there was no further checking in the
following days or medical care provided. The licensee did not think the wounds were serious at the time and did not seek
veterinary care.
The lack of timely veterinary care can cause a treatable condition to become chronic or infected and cause unnecessary
pain and discomfort to the regulated animal.
The licensee must provide appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries, and the
availability of emergency, weekend, and holiday care;.
To be corrected by: The dog was taken to the attending veterinarian during the inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
There was a shitzu female "Ellie" (Brown/white) that had multiple wounds on both back legs in the flank area. The dog 
was in a fight with another female approximately 2 days prior in the run yard. The haircoat was hard to the touch (crusty 
texture) due to tissue fluids from the wounds beneath it seaping. There were several areas beneath the haircoat that 
showed a break in the skin where tooth marks were present. While they didnt appear deep, there was a green puss that 
came out of the wounds in multiple areas and the smell was very pungent and smelled of infection. The legs did appear 
painful upon examination as the dog pulled away several times. The legs appeared swollen/red and warm to the touch. 
While the licensee did seperate the dog and washed down the area after the fight, there was no further checking in the 
following days or medical care provided. The licensee did not think the wounds were serious at the time and did not seek 
veterinary care. 
 
The lack of timely veterinary care can cause a treatable condition to become chronic or infected and cause unnecessary 
pain and discomfort to the regulated animal. 
 
The licensee must provide appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries, and the 
availability of emergency, weekend, and holiday care;. 
 
To be corrected by: The dog was taken to the attending veterinarian during the inspection 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
 n
